required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Reliability of the Near-infrared Imaging System (VistaCam iX Proxi) in Comparison With Digital Radiographic Findings and ICDAS-II in Detection of Approximal Carious Lesions.
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Validity of the Near-infrared Imaging System (VistaCam iX Proxi) in Comparison With Digital Radiographic Findings and ICDAS-II in Detection of Approximal Carious Lesions: Diagnostic Accuracy Study.

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the Clinical performance of the near-infrared imaging system VistaCam iX Proxi in comparison with digital radiographic findings and ICDAS-II in detection of approximal carious lesions.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: screening of the Patients who join the Conservative Dentistry Department clinic will be done until the target population is achieved. The Patients' teeth will be subjected to visual examination and diagnosis using dental charts. once the patient is eligible to be included in this study, they will be contacted by the research investigator who will explain the study and identify the patient interests .If the patient show interest ,further clarification and discussing wil be held .

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year

arm_group.description: Visual tactile examination based on ICDASII scoring system

intervention.description: device for early proximal caries detection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged from 18 to 40 years.
- No gender restriction.
- Patients should have an acceptable oral hygiene level.
- Patients must have at least one posterior proximal caries
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a compromised medical history.
- Severe or active periodontal disease.
- Heavy bruxism or a traumatic occlusion.
- Acute or chronic dental infection.
- Pregnant or breastfeeding women.
- Patients with posterior restorations on molars or premolars
